definition: to dazzle/to boast/to show off/(slang) cool/awesome

sentences.english: I hadn't seen Gordy in years, but the boy always liked to showboat .
sentences.chinese: 我已经很多年没有见到高迪了，但那小伙总喜欢炫耀。

sentences.english: It was just his vulgar way of showing off.
sentences.chinese: 那样子就像歌唱演员表演似的，完全是庸俗的炫耀。

sentences.english: These patricians don’t need gaudy symbols to advertise their wealth.
sentences.chinese: 这群贵族并不需要花俏的商标来炫耀他们的财富。

sentences.english: But he is proud to show off the scars and stitch-marks that cover his belly.
sentences.chinese: 但他却很乐意炫耀自己肚子上的刀疤和缝合的印记。

sentences.english: Eleanor jumps up and down, eager to show off her skills.
sentences.chinese: 埃莉诺跳上蹦下，急着要炫耀她的本领。

sentences.english: Having others pay your cheak is worth showing off, paying your own is worth proud of.
sentences.chinese: 男人付帐值得炫耀，但自己埋单那叫骄傲。

sentences.english: It's also another way that people show off their work.
sentences.chinese: 这也是人们炫耀作品的另一种途径。

sentences.english: Haveing others pay your check is worth showing off, paying your own is worth proud of.
sentences.chinese: 男人付账值得炫耀，但自己埋单那才叫骄傲。

sentences.english: At first, Hermione seemed like a very uptight show-off.
sentences.chinese: 最初，赫敏似乎很爱炫耀自己的聪明。

sentences.english: Having others pay your check is worth showing off , paying your own is worth proud of.
sentences.chinese: 别人付帐值得炫耀，但自己埋单那叫骄傲。

sentences.english: Courtship will include display in which the male fluff up his feather.
sentences.chinese: 求偶的表现包括雄鸟抖松羽毛的炫耀行为。

sentences.english: Tom always flaunts his electronic productions. I really want to make him feel jealous once.
sentences.chinese: 总是炫耀他那些电子产品，我也想让他嫉妒眼红一回。

sentences.english: All the young girls are peacocking in their dresses.
sentences.chinese: 所有年轻的女孩子都在炫耀她们的裙子。

sentences.english: The horse racing gathering is a great chance for guys to show off horsing skills and win a girl's heart.
sentences.chinese: 赛马会上是年轻人炫耀马技赢得姑娘芳心的绝佳场合。

sentences.english: In other words, they can be “show-offs.”
sentences.chinese: 换句话说，他们可能是在“炫耀”。

sentences.english: He's willing to shoulder the heavy burden of flaunting his riches.
sentences.chinese: 他愿意肩负起炫耀自己财富的重担。

definition: to show off/to make a display of
to parade one's wealth/to be ostentatious and extravagant
to belittle/to disparage/to play down/to demean/to degrade/to devalue
variant of 裝屄|装屄[zhuang1 bi1]
to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
to praise/to speak highly of/to commend
